MainCategory.Description: Technical Skills & Experience: This encompasses the candidate's proficiency in required technologies and their experience in software development, relevant frameworks, and database management.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's resume, work samples, and responses to technical questions during the interview. Verify claimed skills through practical coding exercises or by asking detailed questions about past projects.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no relevant technical skills or experience. Lacks fundamental knowledge of required technologies.
Some basic understanding and experience in relevant technologies. Requires significant guidance and training to perform tasks effectively.
Strong technical skills and experience in most required technologies. Can independently handle complex tasks and contribute to projects effectively.
Expert-level technical skills and extensive experience in all required technologies. A subject matter expert who can lead and mentor others.

MainCategory.Description: Problem Solving & Analytical Skills: The ability to identify, analyze, and solve complex software problems efficiently and effectively.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with hypothetical scenarios or real-world problems encountered in software development. Evaluate their approach to problem-solving, their analytical thinking, and their ability to develop effective solutions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to analyze and solve basic problems. Lacks a systematic approach to problem-solving.
Can solve simple problems with guidance. Requires assistance in analyzing complex issues and developing effective solutions.
Demonstrates strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Can independently analyze complex problems and develop effective solutions.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills. Can quickly identify and solve complex problems with innovative solutions. A strategic thinker.

MainCategory.Description: Communication & Collaboration Skills: The ability to communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders, and clients, and to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Observe the candidate's communication style during the interview. Ask behavioral questions about their experience working in teams, resolving conflicts, and communicating technical information to non-technical audiences. Assess their ability to listen actively and respond thoughtfully.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor communication skills. Struggles to express ideas clearly and concisely. Has difficulty working in teams.
Adequate communication skills. Can communicate basic information effectively. Requires some guidance in collaborating with others.
Strong communication and collaboration skills. Can effectively communicate ideas and collaborate with team members. Actively participates in team discussions.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Can effectively communicate complex information to diverse audiences. A strong team player who can lead and motivate others.

MainCategory.Description: Adaptability & Learning Agility: The ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changing project requirements and priorities.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask the candidate about their experience learning new technologies or adapting to changing project requirements. Assess their willingness to learn and their ability to quickly grasp new concepts. Look for evidence of continuous learning and professional development.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Resistant to change and struggles to learn new technologies. Lacks a continuous learning mindset.
Can adapt to change with guidance. Requires support in learning new technologies.
Demonstrates strong adaptability and learning agility. Can quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changing project requirements.
Exceptional adaptability and learning agility. A proactive learner who is always seeking to improve their skills and knowledge.

SubCategory.Description: C# and .NET Proficiency: Depth of knowledge and hands-on experience with C# and the .NET framework, including ASP.NET.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through coding exercises, asking about specific features and design patterns, and reviewing past projects that utilized C# and .NET. Focus on practical application of the technology.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited C# and .NET knowledge; unable to perform basic tasks.
Basic understanding of C# and .NET; requires guidance for complex tasks.
Proficient in C# and .NET; can handle most tasks independently.
Expert in C# and .NET; can design and develop complex applications.

SubCategory.Description: Database Technologies (SQL Server): Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, including T-SQL, ODBC, and SQL Reporting Services.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through questions about database design, query optimization, and reporting services. Practical exercises involving writing SQL queries can be helpful.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited SQL Server knowledge; unable to write basic queries.
Basic understanding of SQL Server; requires guidance for complex queries and database design.
Proficient in SQL Server; can write complex queries and design databases independently.
Expert in SQL Server; can optimize database performance and design complex reporting solutions.

SubCategory.Description: Web Technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS): Familiarity with web technologies for front-end development.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through questions about web development best practices, framework experience (if any), and coding exercises involving HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited knowledge of web technologies; unable to create basic web pages.
Basic understanding of web technologies; requires guidance for complex web development tasks.
Proficient in web technologies; can develop interactive web pages independently.
Expert in web technologies; can design and develop complex web applications.

SubCategory.Description: Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC): Understanding and experience with all phases of the SDLC, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, and deployment.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through questions about their experience with different SDLC methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) and their role in each phase of the SDLC. Focus on practical application and problem-solving within the SDLC.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of SDLC; unable to describe basic phases.
Basic understanding of SDLC; requires guidance for complex projects.
Proficient in SDLC; can manage projects through all phases independently.
Expert in SDLC; can lead and optimize SDLC processes for large projects.

SubCategory.Description: Troubleshooting Skills: Ability to diagnose and resolve software and system issues efficiently.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with hypothetical troubleshooting scenarios and assess their approach to diagnosing and resolving the issues. Focus on their problem-solving skills and ability to think critically.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited troubleshooting skills; unable to diagnose basic issues.
Basic troubleshooting skills; requires guidance for complex issues.
Proficient in troubleshooting; can diagnose and resolve most issues independently.
Expert in troubleshooting; can quickly diagnose and resolve complex issues.
